page.title: 08CHILDREN 2.POEM
page.content: Walking down a desolate road, On my back a heavy load Cowslips daisies fair and light, Autumn winter into spring they fight Hot and weary thirsty too Walking past cows saying 'How do you do' Onto foot bridge along and straight Hurry up all, we'll be late! Passing by fields of corn Looking at the morning dawn Lambs, black and white Frisking about-what a sight!. Sitting down to have our drink and apple Passing a church or is it a chapel?. Electric fence that buzzes and warns Don't touch, it's not very safe. Returning to base sad and thinner Thinking of having a lovely dinner. {by {Stephanie Wood
